intro: Leptospermum scoparium var. confertifolium, commonly known as the dense-leaved tea tree, is a variant of the manuka plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is evergreen, with leathery leaves that are often used in traditional Māori medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in coastal and lowland areas. This variant is also valued for its essential oils, which have antimicrobial properties.
